body.p: Will Practice in Mason and adjoining Counties, also in District and Federal Courts and Courts of Appeals.
Collections in any part of Northern Kentucky will receive prompt attention.

R. H. STANTON
THOS. J. THROOP.
STANTON & THROOP,
ATTORNEYS AT LAW,
Maysville, Ky, July 23 1861
My dear Governor,

Mr William W. Rogers, was fined in the Mason Circuit Court, $25, for striking John Sweet with a cane, Sweet was offensive to him in his language, and called him a thief, and under excitement ^he^ struck him a severe blow, for which he was fined. He is an industrious, hard-working worthy man, and wishes to be relieved from the fine. I think it ought to be remitted and respectfully ask that you do so,
I concur in what Col. Stanton has said above
